BR_text.BRsummary: Exception on teardown with drawing classifier

comments_0.comment_text:
I don't think the exceptions on teardown are the problem. I think the problem is that the process is getting killed.
 After looking into things a bit, I'm almost certain the issue is in the  call. Calculating the confusion matrix is very expensive. I just created <denchmark-link:https://github.com/apple/turicreate/issues/3315>#3315</denchmark-link>
  to track this issue separately. Also unfortunately the  method for the Drawing Classifier always calculates a confusion matrix, regardless of input. We're now tracking that issues in <denchmark-link:https://github.com/apple/turicreate/issues/3316>#3316</denchmark-link>
 .
 Please confirm that you don't get any errors in your script if you remove the call to evaluate.
 To get test accuracy, you should be able to do:
 tc.evaluation.accuracy(predictions, test['label'])
 Given your large number of classes, getting a confusion matrix isn't really feasible at this time.

comments_1.comment_text:
I tried this out and received the same result, exception on teardown, after removing the evaluate call.
 I changed it to:
 <denchmark-code>model = tc.drawing_classifier.create(train_data, target='label')
 
 model.save('Symbols.model')
 
 predictions = model.predict(test_data)
 
 print(tc.evaluation.accuracy(predictions, test['label']))
 </denchmark-code>
 
 And it did not save the model on disk so it appears to be encountered at the end of the model creation.

comments_2.comment_text:
I'm not sure what's going on here. If you get a chance, please try creating the model without an automatically generated validation set. i.e. rather than:
 <denchmark-code>model = tc.drawing_classifier.create(train_data, target='label')
 </denchmark-code>
 
 please try:
 <denchmark-code>model = tc.drawing_classifier.create(train_data, target='label', validation_set=None)
 </denchmark-code>

comments_3.comment_text:
Interesting, I no longer get the exception on teardown messaging, just:
 <denchmark-code>
 | 495          | 0.985295       | 3h 20m       |

 | 497          | 0.991473       | 3h 21m       |
 | 498          | 0.99022        | 3h 22m       |

 | 500          | 0.984441       | 3h 23m       |

 </denchmark-code>
 
 And Symbols.model is not saved on disk.

comments_4.comment_text:
So <denchmark-link:https://github.com/apple/turicreate/blob/0718723f8368aec7328aa4d7018dc7d5d63028ac/src/toolkits/drawing_classifier/drawing_classifier.cpp#L692>the footer of the progress table is getting printed</denchmark-link>
 . Since  should be true, there isn't much else going on in . Perhaps exporting the model to CoreML is the issue.
 It would be helpful if you could determine if it's getting killed in tc.drawing_classifier.create and model.save.
 You may be able to reproduce this issue much faster by passing max_iterations=1 to the tc.drawing_classifier.create. I'm curious if that reproduces the issue.

comments_5.comment_text:
Ok it does occur with just one iteration, thank goodness. I changed it to:
 <denchmark-code>model = tc.drawing_classifier.create(train_data, target='label', validation_set=None, max_iterations=1)
 print("Model created")
 model.save('Symbols.model')
 print("Model saved")
 </denchmark-code>
 
 The results:
 <denchmark-code>(venv) Jordan@Jordans-MacBook-Pro Drawing Classification % python3 2_train.py
 WARNING:tensorflow:From /Users/Jordan/venv/lib/python3.7/site-packages/tensorflow/python/ops/resource_variable_ops.py:1666: calling BaseResourceVariable.__init__ (from tensorflow.python.ops.resource_variable_ops) with constraint is deprecated and will be removed in a future version.
 Instructions for updating:
 If using Keras pass *_constraint arguments to layers.
 Using CPU to create model.
 +--------------+----------------+--------------+
 | Iteration    | Train Accuracy | Elapsed Time |
 +--------------+----------------+--------------+
 | 1            | 0              | 22.81s       |
 +--------------+----------------+--------------+
 zsh: killed     python3 2_train.py
 (venv) Jordan@Jordans-MacBook-Pro Drawing Classification % Exception on teardown.
 Exception on teardown.
 </denchmark-code>
 
 It did sit there after it logged the table for about 2 minutes while using ~100% CPU before it was killed if that's helpful.
 I ran it again and got some additional info and a Python crash report window appeared.
 <denchmark-code>+--------------+----------------+--------------+
 | Iteration    | Train Accuracy | Elapsed Time |

 </denchmark-code>

comments_6.comment_text:
Using synthetic data with approximately the same number of rows and labels, I'm not able to reproduce this behavior.
 Two questions:
 1 - Does this happen every time or only intermittently?
 2 - How much RAM do you have?
 Please share any system logs that get generated. Run the following command:
 tail -f /var/log/system.log.
 Then in a second terminal window, run your script. What gets printed in the first window?

comments_8.comment_text:
Since I can't reproduce the issue, I'm not sure how much more help I can be here. Would it be possible for you to <denchmark-link:https://github.com/apple/turicreate/blob/master/BUILD.md#compiling>compile a local debug version of TuriCreate</denchmark-link>
  and use that? Then you either add debugging print statements or attach a debugger to your process.
